commandList.name: /61plus
commandList.description: Lets you view levels on the 61hz+ list.

commandList.name: /calculate
commandList.description: Lets you calculate how many points you can have.

commandList.name: /help
commandList.description: Command you are using right now.

commandList.name: /leaderboard
commandList.description: Lets you view a player on the LRR Demonslist leaderboard.

commandList.name: /list
commandList.description: Lets you view levels on the LRR Demonslist that aren't beaten only on 61hz+.

commandList.name: ..roulette
commandList.description: Lets you start an LRR route.

Optional Arguments.name: start
Optional Arguments.description: Lets you start a roulette, and choose what type of levels you want. Example: ..roulette start

Optional Arguments.name: end
Optional Arguments.description: Lets you end a roulette, and remove your session. Example: ..roulette end

Optional Arguments.name: score
Optional Arguments.description: Lets you see your score, and the levels you have done as well. Example: ..roulette score

Optional Arguments.name: invite [user]
Optional Arguments.description: Lets you invite a user to your roulette. [user] can be either a User ID or a Mention. Be mindful that once you invite this user, they can start using commands to change your roulette. Example: ..roulette invite 417030333834199042

Optional Arguments.name: skip
Optional Arguments.description: Lets you skip the level you were currently playing. Example: ..roulette skip

Optional Arguments.name: remove [user]
Optional Arguments.description: Lets you remove a user to your roulette, and therefore disallowing them from changing your roulette. [user] can be either a User ID or a Mention. Example: ..roulette remove 417030333834199042

Optional Arguments.name: [integer]
Optional Arguments.description: Percentage for what you got on the level you were playing. [integer] needs to be a whole number. Example: ..roulette 8

Required Arguments.name: start
Required Arguments.description: Lets you start a roulette, and choose what type of levels you want. Example: ..roulette start

Required Arguments.name: end
Required Arguments.description: Lets you end a roulette, and remove your session. Example: ..roulette end

Required Arguments.name: score
Required Arguments.description: Lets you see your score, and the levels you have done as well. Example: ..roulette score

Required Arguments.name: invite [user]
Required Arguments.description: Lets you invite a user to your roulette. [user] can be either a User ID or a Mention. Be mindful that once you invite this user, they can start using commands to change your roulette. Example: ..roulette invite 417030333834199042

Required Arguments.name: skip
Required Arguments.description: Lets you skip the level you were currently playing. Example: ..roulette skip

Required Arguments.name: remove [user]
Required Arguments.description: Lets you remove a user to your roulette, and therefore disallowing them from changing your roulette. [user] can be either a User ID or a Mention. Example: ..roulette remove 417030333834199042

Required Arguments.name: [integer]
Required Arguments.description: Percentage for what you got on the level you were playing. [integer] needs to be a whole number. Example: ..roulette 8

Optional Arguments.name: level
Optional Arguments.description: Input the level name you want. Remember, this is only for levels on the 61hz+ list, and it is case-sensitive. Example: /61plus level: Ragnarok

Optional Arguments.name: addlevels
Optional Arguments.description: What levels do you want to add to your custom profile? You seperate the levels via ", ", and this is case-sensitive. Example: /calculate weighted:True addlevels: Aronia, Erebus, xo

Optional Arguments.name: addprogs
Optional Arguments.description:
What progresses do you want to add to your custom profile? You seperate the levels/percentages via ", ", and this is case-sensitive. If you included a user profile, you can remove one of their levels by making the percentage 101. You also cannot include the % sign while writing in the percentage. Example 1: /calculate weighted:True addprogs: Aronia, 57, Erebus, 89, xo, 97
 Example 2: /calculate weighted:True profile:Luqualizer addprogs:Aronia, 57, Erebus, 101

Optional Arguments.name: profile
Optional Arguments.description: What profile do you want to add on to? This is case-sensitive. Example: /calculate weighted:True profile:Samamba addlevels:Sonic Wave

Required Arguments.name: weighted
Required Arguments.description: Should the score be weighted like the real leaderboard or should it just add up the unweighted points? Example: /calculate weighted:False

Required Arguments.name: user
Required Arguments.description: What user on the leaderboard do you want the bot to show? This is case-sensitive. Example: /leaderboard user:Luqualizer

Optional Arguments.name: level
Optional Arguments.description:
What level on the LRR Demonslist do you want the bot to show? This is case-sensitive. You can also use the world "generate", and it'll generate a random level. Example 1: /list level:Aronia
Example 2: /list level:generate

Optional Arguments.name: number
Optional Arguments.description: Between 1 and what number do you want to roll from? Example: /roll number:457
